text: Sum of money on offer (either side of book and in total) perhaps? Sum total of all matched money? I can't speak for how Michael does it but these are 2 obvious ways of looking at volume without price reference <@UPMUFSGCR>.

elements.text: Sum of money on offer (either side of book and in total) perhaps? Sum total of all matched money? I can't speak for how Michael does it but these are 2 obvious ways of looking at volume without price reference

text:
For what it is worth <@U053KV09FKP> I think if discord posts are the reason you've been ejected, then it is disgraceful (regardless of what you wrote there). But all these bookies have in the T&C that they can shut your account at any time for any reason - and these T&C are something of a Sword of Damocles for anyone who makes their living solely on Betfair.
But you must have had your head in the sand not to realise that there are just some topics that are best avoided today when talking about things publicly. Social media is so rife with confirmation bias and purely binary thinking and there are SO many people out there with nothing better to do than pore over everyone's output actively looking for anything to take offence at or pick at. There is very little scope for any kind of nuanced debate or argument when it occurs solely online and I've seen it get people into trouble in their professional lives. I've heard stories from people I trust about companies actively looking for social media accounts prior to offering a desirable candidate a job to so that they can vet it for controversial opinions and so avoid any potential issues later down the line.
Some content is just flat out offensive (often deliberately so) and rightly gets the posters banned/suspended from the platform they post it on.

text: I personally just avoid discussing certain topics with people who I don't know very well and who know me to be reasonable. Doing the same with anonymous strangers is just a recipe for a headache - especially on social media where binary thinking is the norm. I'll say no more on the topic as I don't really even feel 100% comfortable talking about the subject in this level of vague detail anymore.

text: Thanks <@UUE6E1LA1>. Yes I recall reading a paper suggesting that the price is related to the matched volume (similar to how tote is priced), but could not make it work for me. Maybe I should have dug deeper!
